contentTypes.name: üíé CTA
contentTypes.description: A call-to-action block that features one or more images, designed to engage users and drive them toward a specific action. This element can be included as a section on a webpage, providing visual appeal and a clear directive for users.

contentTypes.name: üß© Image Wrapper
contentTypes.description: This component acts as a wrapper for images, ensuring the inclusion of alt text and other essential metadata for accessibility and SEO purposes. It helps standardize the way images are presented across the application.

validations.message: Keeping it below 125 characters ensures the alt text provides useful information for screen readers and maintains a balance between detail and brevity

contentTypes.name: üîó External Link
contentTypes.description: This component is designed for links to external resources, such as Instagram or other platforms, to ensure a single source of truth and facilitate reuse. It centralizes link management, allowing consistent reference and easy updates across Contentful content.

contentTypes.name: üß© Person
contentTypes.description: This topic is designed to manage content related to individuals, including their name and avatar.

contentTypes.name: üîç SEO
contentTypes.description: A topic for managing SEO metadata, ensuring each page has optimized tags and information for search engine visibility. This includes handling key elements like title tags, meta descriptions, and other attributes that influence SEO.

contentTypes.name: üß© Pexels Image Wrapper
contentTypes.description: This topic manages images sourced from Pexels, a platform that offers a wide selection of free-to-use photographs and graphics.

contentTypes.name: üíé Hero Banner
contentTypes.description: A component designed for creating hero banners, which are large, attention-grabbing banners typically positioned at the top of a webpage. Hero banners often serve as the focal point, conveying key information or messaging to visitors.

contentTypes.name: üß± Base Button
contentTypes.description: This basic link button is designed for use within components like hero banners, providing a simple and effective way to create clickable links.

contentTypes.name: üìú Landing Page
contentTypes.description: This content type is used for building generic landing pages. These pages can be assembled with various content elements and component blocks, allowing for flexible page layouts.

contentTypes.name: üß≠ Navigation Menu
contentTypes.description: This is a singleton for navigation and application settings. Ensure that only one entry of this content type exists. Multiple entries can lead to inconsistencies and potential issues.

contentTypes.name: üíé Rich Content Block
contentTypes.description: A content type featuring a rich text field paired with an image, offering a dynamic and visually captivating presentation of textual content.

Happy music like Chillhop brings relaxation and joy. With smooth beats and uplifting melodies, it‚Äôs perfect for work, study, or unwinding. Chillhop blends jazz, hip-hop, and electronic music to create a positive, laid-back atmosphere, ideal for boosting mood and enhancing productivity.

internalTitle.en-US: Rich Content / About Me - AI Generated

content.value: ! I'm [Your Name], a passionate tech enthusiast with a deep love for exploring the latest advancements in technology. My journey in the tech world began at a young age, and over the years, I've developed a keen interest in various aspects of technology, including software development, hardware innovation, and emerging tech trends.

and enjoy staying updated with the latest tech news and developments. Whether it's coding a new application, building a custom PC, or experimenting with new technologies, I'm always eager to learn and grow.

In my professional career, I've worked on diverse projects that span different domains, from web development to AI and machine learning. I believe in the power of technology to transform lives and am committed to leveraging my skills to create innovative solutions that make a difference.

When I'm not immersed in the world of tech, you can find me sharing my knowledge through blogging, speaking at tech events, or collaborating with fellow tech enthusiasts on exciting projects. I'm also an avid gamer and enjoy exploring the latest in gaming technology.

internalTitle.en-US: SEO / Blog / When Skies Run Dry: Africa's Dance with Rain

title.en-US: When Skies Run Dry: Africa's Dance with Rain | CHI COFFEE

description.en-US: From rituals to cloud seeding, explore Africa's fight for life-giving rain & the enduring hope for a wet future

internalTitle.en-US: Blog / When the Skies Run Dry: Rain, Rituals, and Rainmaking in Africa (2)

title.en-US: When the Skies Run Dry: Rain, Rituals, and Rainmaking in Africa3

content.value: The lifeblood of Africa, rain, can be a fickle friend. Droughts grip the land, leaving parched fields and desperate communities. But throughout history, Africans haven't simply waited for the skies to open. From age-old rituals to modern science, a fascinating dance with rain has unfolded. Let's delve into the heart of African rainmaking, exploring traditional practices, the rise of cloud seeding, and the enduring hope for a life-giving downpour.
A Continent Steeped in Rainmaking Traditions

Across Africa, a rich tapestry of rainmaking rituals has been woven. In Mali, the Dogon people perform elaborate dances to appease the ancestors believed to control the rains. Ethiopian Orthodox priests conduct blessings, while Maasai warriors in Kenya offer sacrifices to their deity, Enkai. These practices, passed down through generations, reflect a deep connection to nature and a profound belief in the power of human intervention.
Science Takes the Stage: Cloud Seeding and the Quest for Rain

As scientific understanding grew, so did the search for more pragmatic solutions. Cloud seeding, a technique where airborne particles are introduced into clouds to trigger precipitation, emerged as a potential answer. Countries like South Africa and Morocco have experimented with cloud seeding with varying degrees of success. While the science is still evolving, it offers a glimpse into a future where rainmaking becomes a more technical endeavor.
The Enduring Power of Hope and Tradition

Despite the rise of cloud seeding, traditional rainmaking rituals haven't vanished. They continue to hold a powerful cultural significance, serving as a source of hope and a way to connect with the land and its spirits. In a world increasingly focused on technology, these practices remind us of the enduring power of human belief and the deep connection between humanity and nature.
The Future of Rain in Africa

As climate change casts a long shadow, the quest for reliable rainfall intensifies. Whether through age-old rituals, innovative technology, or a blend of both, Africa's fight for life-giving rain continues. This captivating story is a testament to human ingenuity, our dependence on the natural world, and the enduring hope for a future where the skies deliver their precious bounty.

internalTitle.en-US: Blog / Example / How to Add Video to a Blog Post in Contentful

title.en-US: How to Add Video to a Blog Post in Contentful

content.value: Integrating videos into your blog posts can significantly enhance the engagement and user experience of your content. Contentful, a powerful headless CMS, provides a flexible way to manage your content and effortlessly add videos to your blog posts. In this blog post, we will guide you through the process of embedding videos in your blog posts using Contentful.
Want to add videos to your blog posts? You can do that easily using the
content type. It lets you choose from three video sources:
Enter the URL of the YouTube video you want to embed.
If you have a Wistia account,
provide the URL of your Wistia video.
If your video is uploaded to your Contentful space,
select "Contentful" as the source and choose the specific video asset.
Here's how to add a video stored in your Contentful space using the Video Wrapper.
Here's how to embed a YouTube video using the Video Wrapper.

body.de: In der Igbo-Kosmologie ist Chi Ihre g√∂ttliche Essenz, der einzigartige Funke, der Ihren Weg leitet. So wie keine zwei Schicksale gleich sind, sollten auch keine zwei Kaffeeerlebnisse identisch sein. Bei Chi Coffee kreieren wir Mischungen, die mit Ihrer Energie harmonieren ‚Äì kr√§ftig, sanft oder vielschichtig, jede Tasse ist darauf ausgerichtet, Ihr wahres Selbst zu erwecken.
body.en-US: In Igbo cosmology, your Chi is your divine essence, the unique spark that guides your path. Just as no two destinies are the same, no two coffee experiences should be alike. At Chi Coffee, we craft blends that resonate with your energy‚Äîbold, smooth, or richly layered, each cup is designed to awaken your true self.

body.de: Bei Chi Coffee beginnt unsere Geschichte mit dem reichen Erbe der Igbo-Kosmologie, wo Schicksal, Balance und Geist ineinander flie√üen. Unsere Vorfahren glaubten, dass Chi jeden Schritt lenkt und unseren Weg formt. Mit dieser Philosophie w√§hlen wir sorgf√§ltig die feinsten Bohnen aus und ehren dabei Land und Anbauer. Jede R√∂stung tr√§gt die W√§rme der Tradition und das Versprechen einer neuen Reise.
body.en-US: At Chi Coffee, our story begins with the rich heritage of Igbo cosmology‚Äîwhere destiny, balance, and spirit intertwine. Our ancestors believed that Chi guides every step, shaping our purpose and path. With this philosophy, we carefully select the finest beans, honoring both the land and the hands that cultivate them. Every roast carries the warmth of tradition and the promise of a new journey.
body.es: En Chi Coffee, nuestra historia comienza con la rica herencia de la cosmolog√≠a Igbo, donde el destino, el equilibrio y el esp√≠ritu se entrelazan. Nuestros ancestros cre√≠an que Chi gu√≠a cada paso, moldeando nuestro prop√≥sito y camino. Con esta filosof√≠a, seleccionamos cuidadosamente los mejores granos, honrando tanto la tierra como las manos que los cultivan. Cada tostado lleva el calor de la tradici√≥n y la promesa de un nuevo viaje.

body.de: Wir glauben, dass Harmonie √ºber die Tasse hinausgeht ‚Äì sie lebt in unserem Umgang mit Bauern, Umwelt und Gemeinschaft. Chi Coffee steht f√ºr ethischen Einkauf, fairen Handel und nachhaltige Landwirtschaft, die Erde und Kaffeebauern gleicherma√üen pflegt. Unsere Reise ist mehr als nur Kaffee.
body.en-US: Harmony goes beyond the cup‚Äîit‚Äôs in how we treat our farmers, community, and the earth. Chi Coffee is committed to ethical sourcing, fair trade, and sustainable farming, ensuring every bean uplifts both people and nature. More than coffee, it‚Äôs about balance, honor, and impact.
body.es: La armon√≠a va m√°s all√° de la taza: est√° en c√≥mo tratamos a nuestros agricultores, la comunidad y la tierra. Chi Coffee se compromete con el abastecimiento √©tico, el comercio justo y la agricultura sostenible, asegurando que cada grano beneficie a las personas y la naturaleza.

- A full-stack React framework for building performant web applications.
- A headless CMS that provides a powerful API for content management and retrieval.
- Supports multiple locales to serve region-specific content.

Contentful is a cloud-based content platform that allows content managers to create and organize content easily. It provides a user-friendly interface for managing content and APIs for developers to fetch and render content dynamically.

Next.js is a React-based framework that simplifies web development by offering:
- Organizing pages through a structured folder system.
Localization ensures that content is presented in a language and format suitable for a user's region. Internationalization prepares an application to support multiple languages and locales.

bio.en-US: Nobody cared to write a bio

content.value: This project is a simple Next.js example that uses Contentful as a CMS. The project utilizes Next.js Internationalization (i18n) as a UI library, and the content for the pages will be fetched from Contentful.
Let‚Äôs go over a few key concepts:

Contentful is a powerful content management platform with an intuitive user interface that allows content managers to create and manage content. It also provides robust APIs for developers to retrieve content and render it in the frontend. Developers create components in the frontend to display the content to end-users.
Next.js is a full-stack React framework that simplifies React development. Developers can use Next.js to create component-driven websites that are highly performant.

: This is the process of showing content to users based on their region. A common use case is writing content in a default language and then translating it into other languages. Locale refers to a language variant specific to a region. For example, German is spoken in both Germany and Austria, but these would have different locales:

: This is the process of ensuring that a website is ready to be consumed across multiple countries and regions. It involves detecting a user‚Äôs preferred language automatically in the frontend and using that information to fetch localized content from the content platform.

When building websites, you will create pages, and each page will have components. For example, a hero banner component might display a headline, some body text, and a button or two. You can easily search for "hero banner component" online for more context.

When working with a content platform like Contentful, we need to create a page and then add components inside that page. For the hero banner component, we would create a content type for the page and a content type for the hero banner. Then, we link them together. This process is repeated for other components.
Content modeling is an art in itself, and Contentful‚Äôs learning center has a lot of training and even live sessions on this topic. Feel free to check that out.
For this project, I‚Äôll focus on four content types that I‚Äôve created:
With these, I can create a page with a few content entries representing a hero banner and a CTA.
After content modeling and creating the content, I need to make API calls to Contentful to retrieve the content and render it. To do that, I need API keys, which I can get in Contentful under
Since I‚Äôm using Next.js, I have to follow some patterns specific to it. You can read more about Next.js
Next.js uses file-based routing, so if I want to have a few pages on my website, each page will have an ID that I can use in the URL. For example, let‚Äôs say my website is

, and I want three pages: the homepage, the about page, and the contact page. I‚Äôll create a dynamic route in Next.js using a field property (e.g., ‚Äúslug‚Äù) from my page content type as a unique ID.

Contentful has a built-in slug generator, which makes it easy to set this up in the landing page content type. In Next.js, I define a dynamic route using the slug as the ID so that I can go to Contentful and fetch the content for any page based on the provided slug.
So, my pages would look like this:
But there‚Äôs more to it. I also want to internationalize my site, so I‚Äôll have different locales for the pages. For example, the about page would look like:

To implement this, I create a dynamic route using ‚Äúlocale‚Äù as the unique ID for each route. When a user visits the site, I need to either automatically redirect them to the correct locale or allow them to pick their language, or even do both.
Most internationalized websites have a locale/language switcher, usually located in the footer. We can implement that as well.
I won‚Äôt go into the details of the implementation here, but this is done using Next.js middleware, where I can intercept requests and redirect them to the appropriate locale.
is responsible for rendering the page. I need to retrieve the locale and the slug (e.g., locale: ‚Äúde‚Äù, slug: ‚Äúabout‚Äù) and use that to request content from Contentful.
To communicate with Contentful from the frontend, I need to install the JavaScript Contentful client library. I can then create a client. Contentful has two key APIs for content retrieval:
, which can fetch both published and unpublished content (more on the preview later)
I can create two client instances‚Äîone for delivery and one for preview‚Äîby passing the respective API keys to each.
Contentful's JavaScript client library has a method called
, which retrieves content entries. This method can accept some options, like passing the slug and an include count to retrieve related content in a single query.
The data I get back from Contentful can then be rendered in the frontend.
